pros: The schedule is very flexible and they work with your class schedule. They're very accommodating.
cons: The only con is that the pay is little.

pros: Great colleagues, great work environment.
cons: Would of loved a full-time role

pros: Good for part time work
cons: No possibility of benefits Little flexibility with scheduling

pros: You have time to study on your own at your available time
cons: Only couple of hours a week but still great for part time

pros: individual interactions with staff and students are great
cons: Culture of fear and oppression. All leadership want those who are capable to be less than they are and contribute only what is needed. I've never been in an environment that has asked me to be less than I can be. Disgusting.

review_title: Good job to grow in, not to stay in
pros: Lot's of opportunities for training and classes.
cons: Support does not come from the top leaders. Experienced employees are not valued.

pros: Truly believes in the mission to help students achieve there goals and off on holidays and weekends along with paid leave.
cons: Pay is lacking and benefits are okay. Top out pay in profession is low unless you are looking to progress to senior college leadership.

pros: I work with great people, and there are so many opportunities to advance. 36-hour summer schedules.
cons: The pay isn't great, but it isn't terrible either.

job_title: Student Success Advisor I in Jacksonville, FL
pros: 36 hour work week in the summer semester, off on fridays. Good leadership depending on campus location. Tuition reimbursement. Off for Christmas break and spring break.
cons: The pay is fairly low.

review_title: I enjoyed my time at FSCJ
job_title: Student Success Advisor I in Jacksonville, FL
pros: 36 hour workweeks in the summer. Spring break and winter break off. Tuition reimbursement.
cons: The pay could have been better.

job_title: Academic Writing Tutor in Yulee, FL
pros: I have never worked in a more supportive environment. My coworkers are responsible and friendly. My supervisors are some of the most conscientious and knowledgable people I've ever met.
cons: The pay is okay, but not great.

pros: FSCJ has a really strong connection with its employees. It's pretty standard for people to jump around departments and meet people on campus in a variety of ways.
cons: Low pay. Poor management style. Inconsistent schedules.

job_title: Business Office Coordinator in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Benefits (health insurance, time off). All holidays and breaks are paid.
cons: Not a lot of opportunity to grow

pros: Coworkers are cool! Hardworking instructors that really care about their students and absolutely love their craft!
cons: A little unorganized at times

review_title: Great Place to Work Except for the Pay
pros: Quality of service to students; excellent teamwork, and superb staff provide above and beyond service; facilitates cooperation and creativity in work environment
cons: For some, the pay is well below the average promoted as median salary for FSCJ graduates; career advancement is said to be impossible, yet from time to time they happen for some employees but not others; there are no merit pay opportunities; no opportunities to advance from one tier or job family to another; many overqualified employees for positions they hold, and once in such positions, employees are not considered for positions that match qualifications—in other words, accepting a position for which one is overqualified in experience and education means a career dead-end with this employer (there are no opportunities for those getting a foot in the door—it’s as if you’re type-cast and gradually careers suffer from years spent in lower classified jobs; in fact, this employer benefits from having highly qualified employees in positions requiring such qualifications, yet unwritten so that standards for professional service are met, while paying such employees as if they are performing lower status or job classification than they are actually performing; it is not uncommon for lesser qualified managers to supervise employees with more experience and education.

pros: Lots of time off, 4 day work week during the summer, good benefits.
cons: Pay for some positions may not be great. But that seems standard for staff jobs in higher education.

pros: Collaborative, autonomy, Student, materials, suppot
cons: Distance, pay, Schedule, some lazy free loaders

pros: Friendly Environment Ways for advancement
cons: Low pay rate Cut hours

review_title: A good place to start a career in a community college
job_title: Professor of Engineering in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Good reputation and a big community college in NE FL. Flexible working hours and can earn more if you are willing to take more courses.
cons: Wages are not that competitive in comparison with you working for an industry

pros: FSCJ has many opportunities for advancement
cons: Limited openings and pay not up to national standard

pros: Work life balance Workers great
cons: Now pay No incentive Lack of communication

pros: This position works with a wide network of profession colleagues, including administration and faculty members, including professors and librarians. The benefits are attractive, and the environment is wonderful. The management team is well staffed with talented leaders and doers.
cons: Company-wide, the pay has gone roughly a decade without any costs-of-living reevaluation, and merit-based raises are virtually unheard of.

job_title: Student Success Advisor I in Jacksonville, FL
pros: It’s a rewarding role that allows you to impact the lives of students.
cons: Can be very time consuming as this role does not accommodate part-time or remote work.

pros: Slight flexibility with your schedule depending on the area you work in.
cons: Overworking and underpaying are a theme with FSCJ.

pros: Flex Time, fridays off on summer
cons: Pay is less compared to other institutions.

pros: Free classes and working with the students bring joy
cons: The culture is very politically and you are always walking on eggshells

pros: Not intense. Not hard. Not much work.
cons: It's being. No progression. Pointless meetings. Fake support systems.

pros: Christmas break off with pay. 1-week spring break off with pay. Some Employees are very helpful.
cons: Administrators and Professionals are out of touch with students. The new president should replace some of his administrators and start new.

pros: You will typically chose your own schedule.
cons: As a peer tutor, you’ll get paid minimum wage.

pros: Do not come here expecting adequate pay for education and experience. The best part of this job is the people you work with. We also have a good amount of PTO and sick time.
cons: No pay raises, no job advancement, no cost of living adjustments.

pros: The benefits are great and lots of time off.
cons: Pay is low and advancement options are limited.

pros: Best Job as a student
cons: Do not expect Full benefits having a part time status.

pros: Make an impact on the lives of students in Northeast Florida.
cons: The College cannot get out of its own way. Culture eats every strategy for breakfast.

pros: Excellent benefits package, generous vacation and sick leave policy, winter and spring breaks, and an atmosphere of acceptance and inclusivity.
cons: Some salaries are low considering the requirements for the jobs.

review_title: It was a good learning experience
job_title: Systems Engineer IV in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Opportunities to learn and use newer technologies.  Shorter work weeks during the summer. Paid time off for national holidays, spring and winter break.
cons: Below average pay compared to similar jobs in the industry.  Promotions are hard to come by because of low turnover.   The increasing demand for more digitally connected learning and reliance on IT services continually adds to the IT staff workload yet positions tend to be decreasing. Pay raises haven't existed around here for several years. Management doesn't seem to notice or care they are burning out their talented or productive employees.

job_title: Student Success Advisor I in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Good leadership at my specific campus. Cannot speak for others.
cons: The pay could be better.

pros:
Decent Pay
Light work load
Can work on other things when not busy
cons:
Very boring
Very little room of getting a promotion unless someone else gets promoted or passes

job_title: Accounts Payable Supervisor in Jacksonville, FL
pros: I like the people I work with
cons: I wish I made more money

job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Free college for you, spouse, and children under 23. Christmas and spring break off. Dress code is not restrictive. Plenty of good people.
cons: I have experienced a lot of nepotism.

pros: Great college and work environment, pay is a little higher than average
cons: Some jobs are kept at temporary status although people may be in them for years.

pros: Freedom to work on projects.
cons: Hierarchical structure btwn faculty librarians (who essentially have the summers off) and part-time adjunct librarians.   Same duties, no benefits.

pros: Great staff to work with.
cons: Working remotely and then coming back.

pros: Great benefits, lots of time off, okay hours.
cons: Mismanagement, racism/sexism dealt with weekly, poor communications skills among team. Not a lot of direction in role.

pros: Great work/life balance with a 36 hour summer work week, and ample time off.
cons: Since leadership has changed, no complaints.

pros: Glassdoor uses global search methods to populate positions using keywords.
cons: Public use of keywords beyond basic use, instructor, professor, etc. Lacks use of innovative technology in public safety positions.

pros: none to have as a pro
cons: all terrible to have been working there

pros: The culture is improving due to new Presidential Leadership and redesign.
cons: The College is still full of people that do not like change.

cons: Professional development, outer department communication can be slow

pros: Learned a lot of things.
cons: I had some good and bad times

pros: Benefits with all the perks
cons: None, just average place of work and very inclusive place

pros: Great Co workers great opportunities for professional development.
cons: Don't get paid over the breaks

job_title: Lead Lab Assistant/Computer Tutor in Jacksonville, FL

job_title: Part Time Cashier in Jacksonville, FL

pros:
Students are usually fun to work with
Great amount of vacation time
Okay benefits package
College is gradually expanding its offerings
cons:
Extremely low salaries for faculty
Teach 5 classes a semester
Too many office hours have to be held 10 a week (2 online)
Did I say low salary...
President has a 3 year-1 million dollar contract and PhDs start off at just over 47,000 
Constant threat of losing positions due to legislature
Constant pressure to serve on committees designed to convince legislature that courses are necessary

review_title: Seventeen years teaching and going strong
pros: Colleagues in my department are like family:  occasional disagreements, yes, but also very supportive and available for discussions both academic and otherwise.  Immediate supervisor/dean wonderful as a mentor and advocate.  Support staff at South campus are professional and valuable in our focus on student success and learning.
cons: Recent upper level changes have (hopefully) gotten rid of an antiquated "old boys" network at the top (campus president and above).  New College president has her hands full but the outlook is very very positive, owing in large part to the Interim Pres who did a great job.

pros: FSCJ offers the staff and faculty some great professional development opportunities including year round workshops and their annual international conference. They also have a very generous paid time off schedule that includes more than a week at Christmas, the week of spring break, and 13 weeks of three day weekends in the summer in addition to earned vacation time.
cons: There is little trust of management and extremely poor morale. Salaries are not on par with equivalent positions at other state institutions. Board of Trustees functions in a reactionary capacity rather than a proactive one.

pros: It's a very rewarding job while you're still in school full time.  You can only work 20 hours a week but it helps to reinforce concepts that you've learned in previous semesters so you don't forget them 2 weeks after the class ends.
cons: The pay is obviously nothing special, and no discounts were offered on tuition.  But the worst part is that only a small percent of the people you help want to be there and learn, the rest are trying to have you do their homework for them or just expect that somehow your knowledge will transfer to them.

pros: There are many great employees  who hold lower titled & paying positions who really care about Students.
cons: Employees who are willing to lie and throw co-workers under the bus for their own benefit are rewarded with higher paying positions. Employees who work hard and go the extra mile for students are rarely rewarded for their efforts, those employees are usually punished for having an opinion other than that of the Administration.

review_title: Unprofessional and unstructured environment with lack of professional  and ethical leadership.
job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Institution of higher learning may inspire professional growth; the ability to achieve satisfaction in helping students aspire to new educational heights.
cons:
Staff and leadership intimidated by change and insecure with job security; clique environment that gives preferences to those involved; use religion as basis of "informal" discrimination and use "informal" intimidation against employees.

Unprofessional management style stiffens employee development and promotion.

pros: FSCJ has a positive environment and working as a student tutor looks good on resumes.  They are also very flexible with schedules and understanding if you have to take time off to focus on studies
cons: The pay is fairly low.  The library where the tutors work is always super cold.  However, if you don't need a lot of money and bring in a sweater, it's a very rewarding job.

review_title: Overall, it's a good place to work and meet new people.
pros: It's a great place to work, they offer free tuition while you work there. Also the schedule is flexible and they are understanding of family situations. There are opportunities for advancement here and you also do a lot of training to make sure we do our best to help students.
cons: Every good job has some down sides, one of the biggest ones is that there are no part-time benefits.Some of the perks could be better. Also it would be nice to have your earning grow with you, year by year.

pros: Pros: I taught at FSCJ part-time for 3 years. Most campuses offer an aesthetically appealing, professional environment. Most of the employees are competent too. The new President has ushered in an new vision that is positive and uplifting, which is great.
cons: Cons: The political atmosphere is stifling. I was warned by a former employee that you can feel like an outsider for years at FSCJ, and this was my experience....and I am a very outgoing, easy going, and professional with no agenda to speak of.

pros: Lot of scope for exploring functionality within Peoplesoft and other technologies. I could work on some of the new business functionality delivered as part of Peoplesoft Finance and Campus Solutions
cons: User community was very resistant to come out of the existing command based IT systems.  Project deadlines kept getting postponed due to non cooperation of existing IT support teams

pros: I got a chance to work with the students, it wasn't that long ago that I was in their shoes so I can relate to some of their questions and concerns.
cons: We need to be as honest with our customer (the students) sd possible and remember that if there are no students we wouldn't have a job.

pros: There are some great people there but they are definitely few and far between. Most of the facilities are nice and the benefits are above average.
cons: Management leaves a lot to be desired. Upper management has let most to all very experienced folks go and replaced them with newer employees while expecting the same results.

pros: Worked part-time for a grant funded program. Loved the hours and the part-time pay.
cons: Unfortunately grants can select to discontinue their support of any program at any time. Politics within employee "circles" and lack of integrity among those circles.

pros: Most jobs are somewhat simple enough, training is non-existent but not needed for most things, common sense will prevail. Jobs are steady, and extra work/late nights are usually not required.
cons: Petty office feuds and territorial redundancy reign supreme. Best not to get into politics, but that is better said than done.

review_title: Very unprofessional. Excess spending by the President while the faculty starved.Too much political maneuvering.
pros: Access to large student enrollment.
cons: Professors are pushed to the limit with little or no reward system. Social responsibility that is taught throughout the courses for students is ignored when applied by the College to its employees.

job_title: Construction Technology Program Adjunct Instructor in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Being in a position to interact with and encourage students to maintain their educational momentum has proven to be quite rewarding. I love it!
cons: I have not experienced too many cons, if any. The most memorable con I can disclose is an experience with and correction of a disrespectful student.

review_title: Great job until state cuts budget
pros: Summer schedule- 4 days a week, 403b matching, free education, one of the best employers in jacksonville.
cons: budget controlled by state funding. ex: FL state gives tax break to home owners, school looses money and cuts jobs.  Labels themselves tech driven, but only does something after many other schools do it.

review_title: Working with FSCJ was one of the most rewarding professional experiences in my career path.
pros:
Student-Centered staff
Tons of professional development training.
Opportunities are available to advance in career.
cons: Salary was not as competitive as I would have preferred, but there were good benefits and the position was rewarding.

pros: Great Working Environment, Wonderful Highly motivated People, Spectacular ethics.
cons: Very little upward mobility, Salary, Tenure.

pros:
Learned how to provide professional customer service 
Learned about the realities of a job in an environment that is flexible.
cons:
Can be tedious work
As a student worker you are not allowed to solve certain problems and must escelate some to your manager, understandable though.

review_title: Goingto college and working in the college made it so much easier to concentrate on studies.
pros:
Convenient to work where you are taking classes.
Flexible work schedule.
Nice environment.
cons: Some of the policy that were hard to follow.

review_title: Love my job the people are great to work with and I enjoy working with the students
job_title: Senior Support Specialist in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The campus is close to my home, the hours, people and atmosphere.
cons: Wage is low compared to other companies

pros: At this point, the only pro is that the paycheck still clears
cons:
Where to begin...
Administration focused on vanity project while all systems fail
Student frustration level high, can't enroll in classes or get financial aid in timely manner
New software package implemented prematurely without testing resulting in chaos
> 50% decrease in enrollment in 10 years
Excellent employees leaving in droves and retiring earlier than planned to get away

pros: By and large my colleagues and my students are the best part of working at FSCJ.
cons: Must teach18 contact hours per semester to make load (that is not a typo) and with the expected service, it's really difficult to do a great job in less than 55 hours a week.

review_title: Great place to invest in the community and empower others
job_title: Associate Director of Recruitment in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Able to create connections with organizations in the community who partner with the college and feel a part of something larger than yourself.
cons: Lack of leadership stability in recent years.

pros: The institution is a melting pot of talent. The student are the lifeline of it and it is them where the focus should be and remain
cons: It is an institution and it is ran as such. In my opinion that policies out weigh people

pros: I love how much direct contact I get to have with students, I am genuinely invested in their academic careers.
cons: I feel like the college as a whole lacks a sense of direction and I feel there isn't opportunity for upward mobility

review_title: Best fit for a job I have had
pros: Ability to assist students, knowing that you are helping the public gain the education they need to advance their careers, good benefits, helpful staff
cons: The reorganization makes it a hectic time to work for the college

pros: I earn an above average rate of pay per hour and surprisingly benefit from earnings to a money market account.
cons: Loss of pay during holidays and semester breaks.

review_title: Not a perfect place, but its a good place to work.
pros: Flexibility in scheduling classes. Academic freedom in teaching course material.
cons: Administration seems disconnected from the needs of the faculty and students.  Pay is quite low compared to both State and National averages.

job_title: Student Assistant in South Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great place to work for college students. It is an easy-going job that allows for homework to be done and to teach you many skills of being at the front desk.
cons: If you don't have homework, it may become quite boring.

review_title: Florida State College at Jacksonville - Master Student: Math
pros: I loved the people I worked with, i.e. supervisor, co-workers, and students. I loved that it fit my class schedule while in school.
cons: Job opportunity is only available to students unfortunately.

job_title: Programming Lab Assistant in Jacksonville, FL
pros: I am the only assistant so I have opportunity to have close relationship with faculties and get to know other students
cons: don't have personal access to lab although I am the only one work there

review_title: Nepotism Like Any Other Small-Town School
pros: Okay pay at $640 per credit hour if you manage time.
cons: Forced to pay into the FRS and cannot choose SS.

pros:
Very laid back. 
Simple requirements. 
Just learn how to work the printers and that is 75% of your job.
cons: Pay is low, but work is easy and is competitive to other minimum wage jobs in city.

pros: Gave more than 14 years to FSCJ and still love what it does for students. Believe FSCJ has great potential, but not under this leadership.
cons: Leadership has created culture of fear and intimidation, which led to staff unable to function effectively. High turnover. Eliminates programs.

job_title: Director of Campus Operations in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Flexibility, Value, and awesome Leadership team
cons: none that I can think of

pros: Good people to work with. Learn a lot about college life and how the ins and outs work.
cons: Pay and hours are not too good compared to other companies.

pros: Students makes FSCJ a good place to work.
cons: There is an organized effort to project a friendly workplace but a new employee can feel like an outsider for YEARS.

review_title: Very relaxed atmosphere with good experience.

pros: This job is great for a college student trying to gain experience before graduating. Management is great.
cons: There are no negatives associated with this job.

cons: Position was an interim appointment and thus, not permanent.

pros: Great schedule, laid back work environment.

pros: simple and easy the task didn't require any special skills

pros: Really enjoyed my time at the university, loved how the institution was student driven
